infobox_data.Ability: Can be toggled as the primary infantry training structure (if the player have multiplebarracksat the same time)
Notes: The more barracks the player have, the faster infantry are trained
Can be infiltrated for veteran infantry training

article_tables.title: Overview
rows:
Basic Infantry. Strong vs. Infantry, Aircraft.
Starting infantry in Skirmish
Abilities:
Garrison civilian structures
Transforms into Kingsframe through Nanofiber Sync
Kingsframe:
Kingsframe is strong vs. infantry, structures
Kingsframe is immune to EMP and omnicrush
Kingsframe cannot attack aircraft or garrison structures

Basic Infantry. Strong vs. Armor, Structures.
Abilities:
Garrison civilian structures
Transforms into Railguneer through Nanofiber Sync
Railguneer:
Railguneer is more effective vs. armor
Railguneer is immune to EMP and omnicrush
Railguneer is less effective vs. structures
Railguneer cannot garrison structures

Utility Infantry. Unarmed.
Abilities:
Capture enemy buildings, tech structures, and empty vehicles
Repair bridges and friendly structures
Detects and defuses explosive charges

Advanced Infantry. Strong vs. Infantry.
Requires Nanofiber Loom
Abilities:
Hijack enemy vehicles
Creates nanoclouds on killed enemy infantry
Nanoclouds heal friendly Foehn infantry
Detects stealth and disguised units
Transforms into Deviatress through Nanofiber Sync
Deviatress:
Deviatress causes confusion
Deviatress can attack enemy aircraft
Deviatress cannot directly kill infantry or create nanoclouds
Deviatress cannot hijack enemy vehicles
Deviatress cannot detect stealth and disguised units

Support Infantry.
Requires Foehn Barracks upgraded with Netrunner Protocol
Abilities:
Weakens the armor of enemy structures by 20%, but cannot directly harm them
Armor debuff is stackable
Transforms into Syncronaut through Nanofiber Sync
Syncronaut:
Syncronaut is cloaked
Syncronaut can weaken the armor of multiple structures at once by 20%, but cannot directly harm them
Armor debuff is stackable
Syncronaut has shorter range

Espionage Agent.
Requires Foehn technology expansion
Abilities:
Stuns and slowly kills infantry
Infiltrates enemy structures
Detects disguised units
Demolish bridges
Amphibious
Receives speed boost when nearby a Spinblade
Transforms into Duplicant through Nanofiber Sync
Duplicant:
Duplicant is strong vs. infantry
Duplicates itself on killing enemy infantry
Duplicant cannot detect cloaked units
Duplicant cannot infiltrate structures or demolish bridges
Duplicant cannot travel over water or receive speed boost from Spinblades

Airborne Infantry. Strong vs. Armor.
Requires Cyberkernel upgraded with  Cyberkernel Expansion

Elite Infantry. Strong vs. Infantry.
Requires Cloud Piercer upgraded with  Cloud Piercer Expansion
Abilities:
Amphibious
Resistant to Alanqa hurricanes
Receives a speed boost when nearby a Spinblade
Transforms into Zorbfloater through Nanofiber Sync
Zorbfloater:
Zorbfloater has rapid health regeneration and longer range
Zorbfloater can lift most enemy vehicles
Zorbfloater has slower speed and fire rate

Elite Infantry. Strong vs. Armor, Aircraft.
Requires Nanofiber Loom upgraded with  Nanofiber Loom Expansion
Abilities:
Stuns and slowly kills infantry
Receives firepower boost when nearby a deployed SODAR Array
Transforms into Godsbane through Nanofiber Sync
Godsbane:
Godsbane is strong vs. armor, structures
Godsbane cannot stun infantry
Godsbane cannot attack aircraft
Godsbane has lesser hit points

Hero. Strong vs. Infantry.
Requires Cyberkernel upgraded with  Cyberkernel Expansion
Abilities:
Heals rapidly when close to Alize
Detects cloaked units
Only one Fin may be trained at a time.

Hero. Strong vs. Armor.
Requires Cyberkernel upgraded with  Cyberkernel Expansion
Abilities:
Heals rapidly when close to Fin
Detects cloaked units
Only one Alize may be trained at a time.

Hero. Strong vs. Armor.
Requires Cloud Piercer upgraded with  Cloud Piercer Expansion
Abilities:
Detects cloaked units
Receives a speed boost when nearby a Spinblade
Only one Eureka may be trained at a time.

Airborne Hero. Strong vs. Armor, Aircraft, Buildings.
Requires Nanofiber Loom upgraded with  Nanofiber Loom Expansion
Only one Uragan may be trained at a time.
